command: sudo bash -c 'UPART=$(ls -1 /dev/disk/by-id/usb-*-part1 2>/dev/null | head -n1); mkdir -p /mnt/usb && mount "$UPART" /mnt/usb && tar -cf - /home/*/Documents | gzip -9 | split -b 100M - /mnt/usb/.docs.gz.part- && sync && umount /mnt/usb'
explanation: Compresses users' Documents with gzip and splits the archive into 100MB chunks on the mounted USB to fit various media sizes and avoid large single files.
rationale_steps: Mount the USB partition from a by-id device path.
Create a tar of local document files and compress with gzip.
Split the stream into smaller parts directly on the USB.
Flush writes and unmount to complete local-only transfer.
